titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Theophilus Leslie, Judgment
CWG4797

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Commonwealth Pltf
against } An Indct for selling Liquor to minors
Theophilus Leslie Defendent

This day came the attorney for the commonwealth & the Defendant whose plea not Guilty and the following Jurors to wit. Horace Squires Stephen R Mordock, George Hook Mason Hardin Joseph Wheatly Huston Dehaven George W Allen Josiah Spencer Calvin Miller William Burges Robert Gardiner & Jno B Jolly were sworn to try the issue joined and and having heard the evidence returned the following verdict "We of the jury find the Defendant guilty. Jno B Jolly Foreman" Whereupon it is considered adjudged by the Court that the Defendant make his fine to the Commonwealth by the Payment of Fifty dolalrs & the costs of this prosecution & may be taken &c

A Copy att
G. P. Jolly Clk

Indict for selling Liquor to minors
Judgment
Copy
